```{r kableExamples}

library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)
dt <- mtcars[1:5, 1:6]

# kable(dt)

# mpg	cyl	disp	hp	drat	wt
# Mazda RX4	21.0	6	160	110	3.90	2.620
# Mazda RX4 Wag	21.0	6	160	110	3.90	2.875
# Datsun 710	22.8	4	108	93	3.85	2.320
# Hornet 4 Drive	21.4	6	258	110	3.08	3.215
# Hornet Sportabout	18.7	8	360	175	3.15	3.440
# Bootstrap theme
# When used on a HTML table, kable_styling() will automatically apply twitter bootstrap theme to the table. Now it should looks the same as the original pandoc output (the one when you donâ€™t specify format in kable()) but this time, you are controlling it.

dt %>%
  kable() %>%
  kable_styling()

```
